title: Zilon
author: Zilon
content: We live in a cruel society, One in which no one can be trusted mostly in under developed and developing nations where majority of citizens live an average life, even the most developed countries are not safe either. This level of hardship among pooe countries can turn good people into bad ones and as well escalate the bad threats in bad people. In as much as we try to keep our hodlings secrete and our transactions private, there are times we need to discuss with the few persons we believe won't stand as a problem when the topic about Bitcoin is discussed with them.In those rare instances how do we really know we are safe with who so ever we chose to discuss matters like this with and also how do we choose our venue for having this conversations because most times discussing this through phone call can be risky as well because the walls have ears and many network providers record calls been held by their customers and this can also become a tool that can put the hodler at hgh risk.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on April 12, 2023, 07:49:09 PMIn as much as we try to keep our hodlings secrete and our transactions private, there are times we need to discuss with the few persons we believe won't stand as a problem when the topic about Bitcoin is discussed with them.You can discuss bitcoin without disclosing your hodlings, profits or how you store your private keys. There are plenty bitcoin topics that can be good conversations to talk about other than how much bitcoins you have in your wallet. Do you feel comfortable talking about how much you have in your bank account with your people? I don’t think so.Quote from: Zilon on April 12, 2023, 07:49:09 PMmany network providers record calls been held by their customers and this can also become a tool that can put the hodler at hgh risk.I don’t think that’s something to be worried about. There are over a million customers using their service, I doubt they would be listening in on your phone conversations unless you’re blacklisted as a suspect for a serious crime that involves national security.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: When talking about Bitcoin, be cautious about what you disclose to others. It's important to refrain from sharing sensitive details such as private keys or account information, and to remain vigilant of anyone who may request this information from you. If you must have a conversation about Bitcoin online or over the phone, it's recommended to use encrypted messaging apps such as Signal or WhatsApp to safeguard the privacy of your discussions.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: Because of the negative publicity and negative perceptions about bitcoin in society, mentioning your bitcoin holdings in public could be dangerous. If you're asked to explain your type of employment or investments, you can disguise yourself and use something unrelated to bitcoin if you're in a location where knowing about your investment could put you in danger. We all know who we trust and the types of people we are surrounded by in our surroundings; once we've adapted, we can discern who to be open to and who not to relate to concerning the type of work we're doing. There’s no special way to know a suitable environment for bitcoin discussion, maybe your instincts could tell. Also, no any network provider will listen to your conversation if you’re not a suspect to be tracked for a susceptible crime offense.

comments.body: Choosing a suitable environment that could enables you have a cryptocurrency itch free experience is very important because this will make you have high and upper hands in it, we consider some challenges base on the in depth of the circumstances around it, some were primary while other secondary challenges, but any place where you could have maximum participation in cryptocurrency without having a barrier is good for a recommendation.

comments.author: drwhobox
comments.body: Seems like OP is living in a hostile area where people do bad things for a living, or it is just my imagination from your post. I don't think it is a good idea to talk about finance with other people if you live in any neighborhood, as you explain. Keep the bad things in you and also keep the good things in you if you really think that you don't trust the person. If you talk about bitcoin or want to engage in a discussion about bitcoin just choose people wisely before you open up anything about yourself.

comments.author: Rockstarguy
comments.body: You can always have discussion about bitcoin with anybody, there is no harm about it. It is only harmful and dangerous if you go to the point of telling people in every discussion of bitcoin about your investment in bitcoin.  Having knowledge of bitcoin and going into discussion of bitcoin does not review what you have got in your bitcoin wallet.  It is very important to be conscious of what you say while having discussion with strangers about bitcoin because giving them your financial status of bitcoin can later be a dangerous case to you. You can teach people or discuss investment with people and not letting them know your worth of investment.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Trust Issues are very sensitive in the midst of a society whose economic level is increasingly squeezed, you must be careful about discussing something that is considered confidential to the people around you, it could be that someone you know can change their mind at any time due to the effects of life's demands. You can discuss Bitcoin in general, what is happening in the market, how the price is moving and any positive/negative issues that may affect the price with them.There are certain limits that you must keep private from others, such as how many Bitcoins you hold, private keys and where your assets are stored. It is necessary to maintain the security of the assets that we have even from the closest people, you never know what is in their minds because when they are hungry and need money, even good people can turn into thieves.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on April 12, 2023, 08:38:56 PMYou really think it is nothing to worry about. How do you think confidential conversations held over the phone between two prominent parties get leaked. How about scenarios where the source of income of a particular person becomes a concern of a countries financial crime unit don't you think going over their past, present and future conversation might occur.It's like paranoia.         Besides, what do you care about famous people? Or do you attribute exactly the same significance to yourself? If you're talking to someone on the phone, then either you know and trust that person, in which case, with rampant paranoia about being tracked because of your identity, you encode the word "Bitcoin" into something that will reassure you, or you just don't talk to strangers.I would be more wary of talking on the phone, knowing that today's technology easily changes people's voices to any voices familiar to us. Therefore, it is better to solve all financial matters face-to-face.
